com.xceptance.xlt.common.tests

Class URLTestCase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xceptance.xlt.api.tests.AbstractTestCase
      • com.xceptance.xlt.common.tests.AbstractURLTestCase
        • com.xceptance.xlt.common.tests.URLTestCase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TDHomepageAndStaticCSV, TDOrderCSV, TLHomepageAndStaticCSV, TLLogin, TLOrder, TLOrderCSV, TLRegister, TLSearchCSV

    public class URLTestCase
extends AbstractURLTestCase
    Here, the important stuff is done:
    • for every URLActionData object from the AbstractURLTestCase.actions List, that was prepared in @Before:
      • create a WebRequest from the URLActionData, depending on the type of request.
      • execute the WebRequest via URLActionDataExecutionable.
      • receive the result URLActionDataExecutionableResult
      • handle and validate the URLActionDataExecutionableResult via URLActionDataResponseHandler.
    • static requests are treated differently. They go to the Downloader and cannot be validated. Therefore before executing an action, we have to take a look onto the next actions in the list to see whether they are static requests and must be added to the Downloader.
    Author:
    matthias mitterreiter

    • Method Detail

      • testURLs

        public void testURLs()
        The first and the last action are treated differently:
        The first action cannot be a static request or a XmlHttpRequest.
        The last action must be executed and validated, but no additional URLActionData is loaded.
